history.proof: intros H. intros i Hi. simpl. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment h : R * R s : SF_seq H : pointed_subdiv (SF_cons h s) i : nat Hi : (i < SF_size s)%nat Unable to unify "pointed_subdiv (SF_cons h s)" with "nth 0 (SF_lx s) i <= nth 0 (SF_ly s) i <= nth 0 (SF_lx s) (S i)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
h: (R * R)%type
s: SF_seq

Goal:
pointed_subdiv (SF_cons h s) -> pointed_subdiv s

Premises:
SF_cons = fun (T : Type) (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : forall T : Type, R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
pointed_subdiv = fun ptd : SF_seq => forall i : nat, (i < SF_size ptd)%nat -> nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_ly ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) (S i) : SF_seq -> Prop
*** [ R : Set ]
belast = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | h :: s0 => seq.belast h s0 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), P s0 -> P (SF_cons h0 s0)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h0 s0)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
SF_map_cons : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_map f (SF_cons h0 s0) = SF_cons (fst h0, f (snd h0)) (SF_map f s0) where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T0 : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
revK = fun (T : Type) (_top_assumption_ : seq T) => (fun (_evar_0_ : (fun l : seq T => rev (rev l) = l) [::]) (_evar_0_0 : forall (a : T) (l : seq T), (fun l0 : seq T => rev (rev l0) = l0) l -> (fun l0 : seq T => rev (rev l0) = l0) (a :: l)) => list_ind (fun l : seq T => rev (rev l) = l) _evar_0_ _evar_0_0 _top_assumption_) eq_refl (fun (x : T) (s : seq T) (IHs : rev (rev s) = s) => (fun _evar_0_ : rev (rcons (rev s) x) = x :: s => eq_ind_r (fun _pattern_value_ : seq T => rev _pattern_value_ = x :: s) _evar_0_ (rev_cons x s)) ((fun _evar_0_ : x ::...
SF_sorted = fun (T : Type) (Ord : R -> R -> Prop) (s : SF_seq) => sorted Ord (SF_lx s) : forall T : Type, (R -> R -> Prop) -> SF_seq -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _]
SF_size_cons : forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_size (SF_cons h0 s0) = S (SF_size s0) where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_rev_cons : forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_rev (SF_cons h0 s0) = SF_rcons (SF_rev s0) h0 where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_ly_cons : forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h0 s0) = snd h0 :: SF_ly s0 where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_lx_cons : forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h0 s0) = fst h0 :: SF_lx s0 where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_lx = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq R Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_cons_cat : forall (x0 : R * ?T) (x y : SF_seq), SF_cons x0 (SF_cat x y) = SF_cat (SF_cons x0 x) y where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_cons_rcons : forall (h0 : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq) (l : R * ?T), SF_cons h0 (SF_rcons s0 l) = SF_rcons (SF_cons h0 s0) l where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
size_rev : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), size (rev s) = size s
SF_behead = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := head (SF_h s) (unzip1 (SF_t s)); SF_t := behead (SF_t s) |} : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_last = fun (T : Type) (y0 : T) (s : SF_seq) => last (SF_h s, y0) (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, T -> SF_seq -> R * T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
size_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), size (rcons s x) = S (size s)
SF_rcons = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := rcons (SF_t s) t |} : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> R * T -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
rev_cons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T), rev (x :: s) = rcons (rev s) x
SF_size = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => size (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_ly = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => unzip2 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> (R -> positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> positive -> R) -> R -> C -> seq (R * positive) -> R
SF_rev = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => SF_make (rev (SF_lx s)) (rev (SF_ly s)) (SF_rev_0 s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
Ring_polynom.r_list_pow : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> seq (R * positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos : forall R : Type, R -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (R -> positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> positive -> R) -> C -> seq (R * positive) -> R
SF_belast = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := belast (SF_t s) |} : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> FExpr C -> R
PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
display_pow_linear : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
gen_phiZ : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> Z -> R
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
SF_rcons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s0 : SF_seq) (t : R * ?T), P s0 -> P (SF_rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
rcons_ind : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P s0 -> P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_rcons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s0 : SF_seq) (t : R * ?T), P (SF_rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
rcons_dec : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [h : R * R s : SF_seq |- Type]
